title.narrative: NDI Ukraine: Promoting Inclusion and Combating Discrimination
NDI Ukraine: Promoting Inclusion and Combating Discrimination

description.narrative:
Insatsens övergripande mål är att stärka kapaciteten hos offentliga organisationer som har i uppgift att främja policymaking som beaktar genderaspekten; att öka förståelsen för fördelarna med jämställdhet på nationell nivå samt att öka toleransen för HBTQI-personer genom evidensbaserade informations- och advocacykampanjer.
Projektets huvudsakliga intressenter är Jämställdhetskontoret (Office for Gender Equality); Utskottet för lika möjligheter (en plattform i parlamentet som över partigränserna verkar för ökad jämställdhet); nationella ledare inom mediesektorn (redaktörer och beslutsfattare) samt civilsamhällesorganisationer som arbetar med jämställdhet och HBTQI-personers rättigheter.

The objectives of the intervention are to increase the capacity of key governmental bodies tasked with promoting gender-responsive approaches to policymaking; to incease public understanding of the benefits of gender equality at the national level; and to increase public tolerance of LGBTI people through evidence-based information and advovacy campaigns that prevent discrimination towards LGBTI people.
The main stakeholders are the Office for Gender Equality (OGE); the Equal Opportunities Caucus (EOC a cross-party platform that seeks to advance gender equality); the Public Council on Gender (a platform made up of more than 100 national and local CSOs); national media leaders (editors and decision makers) and LGBTI CSO's.

tag.narrative: 5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: Some of the high-lighted concrete results from the relevant project period lifted in the latest narrative report: - NDI’s gender team began liaising, formulating national gender policy, and shared research with the Vice Prime Minister’s Office for European and Euro-Atlantic Integration of Ukraine (VPM) and the Office of the Government Commissioner for Gender Equality Policy (OGE). NDI is coordinating with UN Women who also recieves support from Sweden to enhance the government's capacity for coordinating gender work. - NDI also hired two consultants to assist the Vice Prime Minister’s Office with gender-related work. - NDI and a local publishing house launched a children’s book, “She Did It,” focused on women’s leadership and contributions to Ukrainian history. - NDI engaged in a media campaign by holding two, jointly funded, regional marathons aimed at promoting equality and challenging gender stereotypes. - NDI's gender team, together with The Equal Opportunities Caucas and UN Women, organised a national women’s congress in Odessa with the participation of elected officials and representatives of international organizations. - A research plan for period 2018-2020 has been developed by NDI in consultation with Vice Prime Ministers office (VPM and the Office of the Government Commissioner for Gender Equality Policy (OGE). - For more details, se the narrative report submitted in Sep 2017.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
